instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
I'm working on 820-00165 which as customer says has died after plugging headphones to the jack. He turned it on after that, but computer went off while loading system. Board is perfectly clean, no corrosion, no liquid, no burnt components. After plugging charger in, there is green and orange light, but no fan spin. 

- PPBUS is stable 8,59v, 
- I have all S5 rails. 
- PM_SLP_S4_L and PM_SLP_S3_L are pulsing, the same ALL_SYS_PWRGD and S0 rails - I get CPU VCORE and PP_1V05_S 0 for half a second, then second time and later no pulse.
- current sense resistors are ok
- no corrosion on J6100
- I have removed U6410 - no results,

Nothing gets hot, CPU and PCH have good resistance. I have tried known good BIOS, but it gives no difference. In SMC bypass mode fan spins once and stops.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
Did you try the board alone, disconnecting LIO flex?
In fact, disconnect any other device.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Yes, board is out of case, everything disconnected except DC board

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: From DC (LIO) board, keep only 5 pins cable connected.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: I do, I haven't connected I/O flat cable.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
If board is clean, can be CPU problem.
However, check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.

Check for pulse at CPU_VCCST_PWRGD and PLT_RESET_L.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD is pulsing to ~1v,
PLT_RESET_L is pulsing to ~3,3v

it pulses only twice, and later nothing happens. 

SPI resistors are ok.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Then should be CPU internal problem...

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Lots of things can cause pulsing, including sensors issue. Some unorganized info: [URL]https://logi.wiki/index.php/820-00165_Pulsing[/URL]

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
Everything can happen with electronics, but in this case it's hard for me to believe that headphones have killed CPU. Ok, PCH is related to audio, but anyway if it would be CPU/PCH they would die permanently. Customer claims that computer has started after that but shut down while loading system.

[USER=1057]@piernov[/USER], thank you for the link. I will follow these steps and report.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: I've checked everything you have mentioned about twice pulsing in LogiWiki, no described causes found on my board. But something interesting happened: I decided to reflow the SMC, just in case. After that board started, I had two short fan spins, then nothing, but CPU VCORE was present all the time, stable 1,8V. I thought it's BIOS I have used just for testing (known good for this board), so I flashed it with original one. This time I got RTC reset (fan spin-stop-spin) and it was working like this for about 15 seconds, CPU got warm. Then it turned off. I've replugged charger, there was no fan spin this time but CPU VCORE and other S0 rails were present again, CPU got warm. Now it's dead again, only twice pulsing..

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
I recently had 00165 with same symptom.
Tried BIOS, no change.
Tried SMC reflow, still the same.

I then remove U8130 and board stays on.
I resoldered U8130 and board started working good.
No corrosion found close to U8130 and also had goos solders.

I can only suppose crap accumulated underneath CPU chip (PCH area).
Reflowed that area, just in case; machine still working good.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: U8130 on this board looks perfect too, as well as traces. But I removed it and it made no difference. I've USC'ed the boad, no effect..

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message:
This sympyom is a nightmare.
Many times CPU internal fault.

Try to start in SMC bypass, just in case...

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: In SMC bypass mode fan spins twice on high speed then stops and nothing happens, S0 rails are not present.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: I've posted on another thread but I'm having the EXACT same problem. I've also done pretty much everything you have... frustrating.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: [USER=26621]@grmacs[/USER] I've seen your thread. Any news?

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Not yet. Frustrating that these boards can run with 3 sheets of garbage and junk on the board and ya get a clean one and can’t fix it haha

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: I’m going to try to USC mine to see. May try swapping the smc as a last effort. I’m guessing both are long shots

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: USC didn't do anything different. If it were a sensor issue it would stay running in SMC bypass, correct?

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Is not sensor issue, as board also fails in SMC bypass.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Tried SMC swap. Same result. No fan spin unless SMC Bypass then i get two short fan spins.

threads.title: 820-00165 not starting, all S0 rails pulsing
threads.message: Exactly same story on mine.. looks like we have found lost twin sisters.. :D
